Chapter V: May 8–May 31, 1945
Beginning of open Conference discussion of Dumbarton Oaks Proposals and changes recommended by Sponsoring Powers and other participating Governments; exploratory discussions in meetings of United States delegation to establish position to be taken by U.S. delegates on all matters in connection with Conference; consultative meetings with other Sponsoring Governments and France to reach unanimous agreement on final position to be taken in meetings of the twelve technical committees by any one of the Five Powers with respect to proposed amendments; informal consultative meetings of United States delegates with Latin American representatives on regional arrangements; Five-Power agreement reached with regard to proposals on regionalism and trusteeship.
